title: Evolution from Academic Paper to Practical Guide
summary: How community feedback transformed an over-engineered academic paper into a usable methodology

context.project_background: Initial version was a 50+ page academic paper with extensive theory
context.problem_statement: Methodology was too complex and academic for practical use
context.feedback_received: Remove theoretical bloat, be honest about metrics, make it flexible

phases_used.description: Re-evaluated what the methodology should achieve
Defined new requirements based on feedback
Rewrote entire paper with new approach

critical_interventions.moment: Feedback about Shannon entropy and cognitive load formulas

critical_interventions.intervention: Admitted real factor was requirement change

critical_interventions.impact: Methodology became flexible tool rather than prescription

process.iterations: Major rewrite in single session based on feedback

challenges.solution: Focus on practical application over theory
Brutal editing guided by YAGNI principle

lessons_learned.insight: Academic complexity often hides simple truths
Honest limitations more valuable than inflated claims

lessons_learned.evidence: Most projects need 2-3 phases, not all 6

lessons_learned.insight: Community feedback invaluable for reality check

methodological_reflection.phase_flexibility: Used minimal phases for maximum impact

quotes.text: You don't need cognitive load theory, dual epistemologies, or Shannon entropy to use LLMs effectively
The best methodologies are simple enough to remember and flexible enough to adapt
